cml.module: Carotenoids and related . Part 8. Total synthesis of optically active applying the stereoselective rearrangement of tetrasubstituted
Biomimetic synthesis of mytiloxanthin was accomplished with stereoselective rearrangement of the tetrasubstituted as a key reaction. This is the first total synthesis of optically active all-E .

UV-VIS spectra were recorded on a JASCO Ubest-55 instrument for
s unless otherwise stated. IR spectra were measured on a Perkin Elmer FT-IR spectrometer, model Paragon 1000, for
s. 1H NMR spectra at 300 or 500 MHz were determined on a Varian Gemini-300 or a Varian VXR-500 superconducting FT-NMR spectrometer, respectively, for
n in Hz. NMR assignments are

n using the carotenoid numbering system. Mass spectra were taken on a Hitachi M-4100 spectrometer. Optical rotations were measured on a JASCO DIP-181 polarimeter ([[alpha]]D-values are in units of 10-1 deg cm2 g-1). CD spectra were measured on a Shimadzu-AVIV 62A
gel (Merck Art. 7734). Short-column chromatography (SCC) was carried out on
gel (Merck Art. 7739) under reduced pressure. Preparative TLC (PTLC) was conducted on
thickness). Low-pressure CC was performed on a Yamazen Low Pressure
Chromatography System using a Lobar column (Merck LiChroprep
60). Analytical and PHPLC were carried out on Shimadzu LC-6A, or Waters 510 instruments with UV-VIS detectors.

cml.ACKNOWLEDGMENTS: We thank Dr T. Maoka, Kyoto Pharmaceutical University for his kind gift of spectral data on natural mytiloxanthins. We are also grateful for the chemical support from Drs U. Hengartner and K. Bernherd, Hoffmann-La Roche Ltd., Basel, Switzerland.

FOOTNOTELIST.FOOTNOTE: We have employed the numbering system used in carotenoids.
